blurb: These are songs from before I started this project. Re-recorded for it, to bring them into the fold and free them from their past housing. The main condition for them to be carried forward was that they could stand alone as poems without music. And I think for the most part they do.

During this time I was transfixed by the idea of this ‘thing’ that lies just beyond the scope of our experience, the thing that lets us see beauty and magic where objectively there is only a flower or a tree. In the Medieval Era they called it God, in the 18th centry they thought it was fairys, maybe now we just call it the human soul. I couldn't help but by be drawn by the idea of this ‘essence’ lying just beyond the realm of our senses, yet close enough to feel, and to invoke when we must dull the pain of the incomprehensible.
